Amazon Says One-Off Costs Ate Into Operating Income â€” Market Talk
data.description: Amazon's operating income was weighed down by a legal settlement and costs related to job cuts. The company recorded $17.4 billion in operating income for the third quarter, which was below analysts expectations of $19.7 billion. Amazon said it had a $2.5 billion special charge related to a legal settlement with the Federal Trade Commission and spent about $1.8 billion on severance costs related to planned role eliminations. Without these charges, operating income would have been $21.7 billion, the e-commerce company said. (katherine.hamilton@wsj.com)

data.title: Eldorado Gold Q3 revenue beats estimates
data.description:
Overview

  • Eldorado Q3 revenue beats analyst expectations

  • Adjusted EPS for Q3 misses estimates due to derivative losses

  • Gold production decreased due to challenges at Olympias site

Outlook

  • Eldorado Gold tightens 2025 gold production guidance to 470,000-490,000 ounces

  • 2025 Skouries project capital guidance increased to $440-$470 mln

Result Drivers

  • LAMAQUE PRODUCTION - Higher production at Lamaque due to accelerated processing of bulk samples at Ormaque

  • OLYMPIAS CHALLENGES - Lower production at Olympias due to flotation circuit challenges

  • ROYALTY EXPENSES - Increased production costs due to higher royalty expenses driven by record gold prices and increased royalty rates in Turkiye

data.title: US soy futures set 15-month high after China agrees to purchases
data.description:
Key points:
  • US farmers welcome trade deal after China shunned their crops
  • China to buy millions of tons of American soy, US officials say
  • Deals fall short of recent US exports to China, data show

By Tom Polansek

U.S. soybean futures reached a 15-month high on Thursday after President Donald Trump's administration said top-importer China agreed to buy tens of millions of tons of American crops in the next few years as part of a trade truce.

Farmers welcomed the agreement after China shunned U.S. soybeans as it battled with Trump over tariffs and shifted purchases to rival producers in South America. However, the deals fall short of U.S. exports to China in recent years.

"It's not over and above what they had been doing in the past, but it's definitely helpful," said Illinois farmer Sherman Newlin, who is also an analyst for Risk Management Commodities.

Most-active soybean futures ended up 13-1/4 cents at $11.07-3/4 a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade. Prices earlier rose to $11.14-1/2, a level not seen since July 2024.

The trade dispute robbed U.S. farmers of their biggest market as they struggled with low crop prices and rising costs for inputs such as fertilizer.

Following a meeting between Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, China will buy at least 12 million metric tons of U.S. soybeans this year, U.S. Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said on X. China will then buy at least 25 million metric tons each year in 2026, 2027 and 2028, she said.

The U.S. exported 26.8 million metric tons to China in 2024; 26.4 million metric tons in 2023; and 30.2 million metric tons in 2022, according to U.S. government data.

Excluding the last two years, China purchased 28 million to 36 million metric tons of U.S. soybeans annually over the last 10 years, the Iowa Soybean Association said.

"Today's announcement addresses many of the concerns around market access to China following months of stalled purchases and uncertainty," said Iowa farmer Tom Adam, the association's president.

In the near term, exporters will probably buy U.S. soybeans to ship to China quickly, said Don Roose, president of Iowa brokerage U.S. Commodities. However, the trade deal looks underwhelming over the longer term because of uncertainty about whether China will live up to its commitments, he said.

In 2020, Trump signed a "Phase One" trade deal with Beijing to end his first-term U.S.-China trade war. Beijing never met the purchase targets in the agreement.

"We've seen this before," Roose said.

In other markets, CBOT corn fell 3-3/4 cents to $4.30-1/4 a bushel and wheat dropped 8 cents to $5.24-1/4 a bushel.

data.title: AptarGroup, Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
data.description:
AptarGroup, Inc., a global leader in drug delivery and consumer product dosing, dispensing, and protection technologies, has released its financial results for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's performance for the period ended September 30, 2025, compared to the same period in the previous fiscal year.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, AptarGroup reported a 6% increase in sales, reaching $961 million, with core sales up by 1%. The company's net income rose by 28% to $128 million, translating to an earnings per share (EPS) increase of 30% to $1.92. Adjusted EPS, which excludes non-ordinary-course litigation costs, saw a 4% rise to $1.62. Adjusted EBITDA also increased by 7% to $223 million, with an adjusted EBITDA margin of 23.2%, up from 22.9% in the prior year.

Business and Operational Highlights

The company experienced strong product volume growth in its Closures and Pharma segments, particularly in injectables, which grew by 18% in the third quarter. Aptar Pharma's reported sales increased by 6%, driven by higher volumes in prescription drugs, injectables, and active material science solutions. However, consumer healthcare sales declined by 11% due to softer demand in nasal and cold products, especially in Europe.

Aptar Beauty's reported sales increased by 8%, with a 4% benefit from currency changes and a 4% contribution from acquisitions. However, core sales remained flat. Aptar Closures saw a 1% increase in reported sales, but core sales decreased by 1% due to lower tooling sales and pass-throughs of lower resin pricing.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

During the third quarter, Aptar returned $70 million to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends. The company repurchased 286,000 shares for $40 million. Additionally, Aptar's Board of Directors approved a quarterly cash dividend of $0.48 per share, payable on November 13, 2025.

Management's Perspective

Stephan B. Tanda, Aptar's President and CEO, commented, "Aptar delivered solid third quarter results with strong product volume growth in Pharma and Closures. As we anticipated, we are seeing the steady ramp in sales in our injectables division, which grew 18% in the third quarter, indicating an expected strong finish to the year for elastomeric components. Our continued focus on innovation, operational excellence, and disciplined capital deployment positions us well to deliver sustainable value for our customers and shareholders, while expanding our third quarter adjusted EBITDA margin."

Future Outlook

Looking ahead, Aptar expects its Pharma pipeline to remain strong, contributing 7% to 10% of revenue annually. The company anticipates continued growth in injectables, driven by accelerating demand for GLP-1, Annex-1, and biologics applications. However, Aptar expects lower revenue from emergency-use delivery systems in 2026 compared to 2025. The company currently projects adjusted earnings per share for the fourth quarter of 2025 to be in the range of $1.20 to $1.28, based on an effective tax rate range of 19.5% to 21.5%.

Original SEC Filing: APTARGROUP, INC. [ ATR ] - 8-K - Oct. 30, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: ACCO Brands Corporation Reports Third Quarter Results
data.description:
ACCO Brands Corporation, a leader in branded consumer products, has released its financial results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. The company reported a mixed performance with some areas of strength and others showing challenges.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter, ACCO Brands reported net sales of $383.7 million, a decrease of 8.8% from $420.9 million in the same period last year. The gross margin expanded by 50 basis points, and selling, general, and administrative (SG&A) expenses were down compared to the prior year. The company achieved earnings per share (EPS) of $0.04, with adjusted EPS at $0.21, aligning with the company's outlook.

Operating income for the quarter was $26.0 million, slightly down from $26.3 million in the previous year. Adjusted operating income was $39.2 million, reflecting a decline from $44.7 million in 2024. Net income stood at $4.0 million, or $0.04 per share, compared to $9.3 million, or $0.09 per share, in the prior year. Adjusted net income was $19.5 million, down from $22.5 million in 2024.

Business and Operational Highlights

ACCO Brands' Americas segment saw a 12.2% decrease in net sales to $227.6 million, impacted by softer demand, partially offset by price increases. The International segment experienced a 3.5% decline in net sales to $156.1 million, with favorable foreign exchange contributing positively.

Operating income for the Americas segment was $24.7 million, down from $25.9 million, while the International segment reported an increase in operating income to $10.5 million from $9.5 million in the prior year.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

The company highlighted its multi-year cost reduction program, which has yielded over $50 million in savings. ACCO Brands also reaffirmed its commitment to innovation and strategic opportunities to drive growth. The company paid dividends of $20.3 million year-to-date and repurchased 3.2 million shares of common stock for $15.1 million in the first quarter.

On October 24, 2025, the board of directors declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.075 per share, payable on December 10, 2025, to stockholders of record at the close of business on November 21, 2025.

Management's Perspective

Tom Tedford, President and CEO of ACCO Brands, stated, "We delivered third quarter adjusted EPS in line with our outlook and expanded gross margin by 50 basis points as we continue to demonstrate strong operational discipline through continued execution of our $100 million cost reduction program. Sales were lower than expected in the quarter, as the demand environment for many of our categories remained soft globally. We expect sales trends to improve in the fourth quarter, reflecting the favorable impact of foreign exchange and growth in the technology accessories categories."

He added, "We are confident in our ability to deliver future value creation for our shareholders. Our teams continue to execute on our cost management initiatives, while remaining focused on enhancing our revenue opportunities."

Future Outlook

ACCO Brands reaffirmed its full-year 2025 outlook, expecting reported sales to decline in the range of 7.0% to 8.5%. Full-year adjusted EPS is projected to be between $0.83 and $0.90. The company also anticipates adjusted free cash flow to be within the range of $90 million to $100 million, including $17 million in cash proceeds from the sale of two facilities.

Original SEC Filing: ACCO BRANDS Corp [ ACCO ] - 8-K - Oct. 30, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: Key facts: Petrobras approves logistics center; GQG reduces stake; Amazon deforestation at 11-year low
data.description:
• Petroleo Brasileiro SA (PETR3) has approved studies for a logistics center in Amapa, Brazil, to enhance operations following recent promising offshore drilling.1
  • GQG Partners LLC has reduced its stake in Petroleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobras) to 4.92% of the company's common shares, as reported in a recent filing.2
  • Deforestation in Brazil's Amazon fell by 11.08% over the past year, hitting an 11-year low, while the government backs Petrobras' drilling plans near the Amazon River.3
